main_definition: A group of individuals born and living at the same time, typically within a span of 20-30 years.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Referring to different groups or cohorts spanning multiple decades
meanings_and_examples.example: The comparison between Baby Boomers and Millennials reflects the changes in values across generations.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Denoting the passage of time over a span that encompasses several distinct age groups or eras
meanings_and_examples.example: The study analyzed trends spanning multiple generations, from the Greatest Generation to Gen Z.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Describing the transfer of cultural values and traditions across different time periods
meanings_and_examples.example: Generational gaps in political beliefs can often be attributed to differing upbringings and societal influences experienced by each generation.
